articles.title: The new top-flight Canadian club inspired by Athletic Bilbao
articles.summary: Supra du Quebec kick off their inaugural Canadian Premier League in April and will field only players born or raised in the province.

articles.title: How did Arsenal 'unlock' Sunderland's defence?
articles.summary: Match of the Day pundit Alan Shearer explains how a "piece of brilliance" combined with effective substitutions allowed Arsenal to break down Sunderland's defence, in their 3-0 home win in the Premier...

articles.title: Positivity key to West Ham's upturn in form - Shearer
articles.summary: Match of the Day pundit Alan Shearer explains how West Ham were able to "play on the front foot" and pressurise Burnley's defence, thanks to the 4-4-2 formation implemented by manager Nuno Espirito Sa...

articles.title: How Carrick set up brilliant Fernandes-led Man Utd attack
articles.summary: Match of the Day pundit Danny Murphy breaks down how Michael Carrick has set up Manchester United to get the most out of their potent attacking players.

articles.title: Super League 2026: 10 intriguing signings to watch
articles.summary: With the 2026 Super League season just around the corner, Sky Sports' Megan Wellens picks out 10 big signings to keep a keen eye on...

articles.title: Are West Ham single-handedly making relegation battle interesting?
articles.summary: BBC Sport looks at how things are shaping up as the fight for Premier League survival hots up.

articles.title: Palmer scores first-half hat-trick as Chelsea beat Wolves
articles.summary: Cole Palmer becomes the first player in Premier League history to score three career first-half hat-tricks, as Chelsea see off Wolves 3-1 at Molineux.

articles.title: Gyokeres scores twice as Arsenal beat Sunderland
articles.summary: Viktor Gyokeres scores two goals as Arsenal comfortably beat Sunderland 3-0 to extend their lead at the top of the Premier League table to nine points.

articles.title: Romero red helps Man Utd continue perfect start under Carrick
articles.summary: Goals from Bryan Mbeumo and Bruno Fernandes help Manchester United to a 2-0 win over 10-man Tottenham, who saw captain Cristian Romero sent off for the second time this season in the Premier League.

articles.title: Everton produce second-half comeback to beat Fulham
articles.summary: Everton score twice in the final fifteen minutes to secure a 2-1 away win over Fulham at Craven Cottage in the Premier League.

articles.title: West Ham beat Burnley to boost survival hopes
articles.summary: Goals from Crysencio Summerville and Taty Castellanos give West Ham a crucial 2-0 win against Burnley, to move them within three points of 17th-placed Nottingham Forest in the Premier League.

articles.title: Teenager Rayan scores as Bournemouth draw against Villa
articles.summary: Bournemouth come from behind to earn a 1-1 draw with Aston Villa, thanks to a goal from Brazilian teenager Rayan on his first start for the club.

articles.title: When I get back to full fitness I can go to another level - Palmer
articles.summary: Chelsea midfielder Cole Palmer discusses how his injuries have affected him this season, but says that he can "go to another level" when he reaches full fitness after the England international scored ...

articles.title: Man Utd beat Leicester to close gap on league leaders
articles.summary: Watch highlights as Elisabeth Terland continues her impressive scoring run against Leicester City as Manchester United close the gap on Women's Super League leaders Manchester City to eight points.

articles.title: Barcelona withdraw from European Super League project
articles.summary: Barcelona withdraw from the European Super League project, leaving rivals Real Madrid as the only one of the original 12 clubs still signed up to the plans.

articles.title: West Brom out of drop zone after draw with Stoke
articles.summary: West Bromwich Albion move out of the Championship relegation zone after a goalless draw with Stoke City at The Hawthorns.

articles.title: Suryakumar rescues India after USA scare at T20 World Cup
articles.summary: Suryakumar Yadav spared India's blushes with a superb unbeaten 84 from 49 balls as the co-hosts beat USA by 29 runs in their opening T20 World Cup match in Mumbai.
